comment.author: 38811045@N04
comment._content: An Irish Guardsman since Jan/Feb 1909 and therefore presumably on the Army Reserve when war was declared.  Arrived overseas 13/09/1914 according to MIC which also notes "assumed dead 6.11.14". De Ruvigny's notes buried at Klein Zillebeke so presumably disinterred subsequently.  Came from a military family.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
There is a William Brennock aged 20 listed on the 1911 census for the barracks in Belgrave, St George Hanover Square, London. Irish Guards. Born Dublin.
Civil registration shows a birth in the second quarter of 1891 in Dublin South. 
Ireland, Casualties of World War I, 1914-1918 for William Brennock confirms this.
